description: aqua-green (enameled steel) top and sides; black (bakelite) short ends; attached cord
text: The modern toasters of the 1950s with their sculpted shells were designed to convey streamlining and efficiency while hiding a thicket of red-hot wires and coils. Models varied from nickel-, and a little later, chromium-plated steel sides (providing insulation) to enameled steel harmonizing with the pastel shades of the newest kitchen decor.
title: Toaster
